00034 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00035 
00036 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00037 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00038 
00039 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   4096
00040 
00041 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00042 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00043 
00044 struct xnthread;
00045 struct task_struct;
00046 
00047 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00048 
00049     /* Kernel mode side */
00050 
00051 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00052     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00053        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00054     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00055     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00056     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00057     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00058        - NULL for RT K threads,
00059        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00060        - current for RT US threads.
00061     */
00062 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00063 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00064 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00065 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00066 
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00070     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00071 
00072     /* User mode side */
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     /* Init block */
00077     struct xnthread *self;
00078     int imask;
00079     const char *name;
00080     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00081     void *cookie;
00082 
00083 } xnarchtcb_t;
00084 
00085 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00086 
00087     unsigned exception;
00088     struct pt_regs *regs;
00089 
00090 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00091 
00092 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00093 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->regs->dar)
00094 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00095 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->nip)
00096 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00097    Linux stack context. */
00098 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00099                                  ((fi)->exception != ADEOS_IABR_TRAP && \
00100                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_SSTEP_TRAP && \
00101                                   (fi)->exception != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP))
00102 #ifdef __cplusplus
00103 extern "C" {
00104 #endif

00106 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00107 
00108 {
00109 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00110     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00111         return vmalloc(bytes);
00112 #endif
00113 
00114     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00115 }
00116 
00117 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00118 
00119 {
00120 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00121     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00122         vfree(chunk);
00123     else
00124 #endif
00125         kfree(chunk);
00126 }

00131     rthal_irq_host_pend(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00137

00140 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00141                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00142 {
00143     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00146 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00147 
00148 {
00149     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00150 
00151     adeos_load_cpuid();
00152 
00153     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00154        and always inside a critical section. */
00155     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00156     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00157     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00158 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00159     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00160     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00161     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00162                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00163                     : NULL);
00164 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00165 }
00166 
00167 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00168     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00169 }
00170 
00171 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00172                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00173 {
00174     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00175     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00176 
00177     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00178 
00179     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00180         {
00181         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00182 
00183         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00184 
00185 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00186         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00187            they don't work properly in our context. */
00188         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00189             asm volatile (
00190                 "dssall;\n"
00191 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00192                 "sync;\n"
00193 #endif
00194                 : : );
00195         }
00196 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00197 
00198         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00199         get_mmu_context(mm);
00200         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00201 
00202         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00203          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00204         current = prev;
00205         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00206 
00207         barrier();
00208         }
00209     else
00210         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00211         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00212 }
00213 
00214 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00215                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00216 {
00217     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00218 }
00219 
00220 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00221 
00222 {
00223     /* Empty */
00224 }
00225 
00226 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00227                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00228                                          const char *name)
00229 {
00230     tcb->user_task = current;
00231     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00232     tcb->ksp = 0;
00233     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00234 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00235     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00236     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00237 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00238     tcb->entry = NULL;
00239     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00240     tcb->self = thread;
00241     tcb->imask = 0;
00242     tcb->name = name;
00243 }
00244 
00245 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00246 
00247 {
00248     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00249     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00250     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00251     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00252 }
00253 
00254 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00255                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00256                                        void *cookie,
00257                                        int imask,
00258                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00259                                        char *name)
00260 {
00261     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00262 
00263     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00264 
00265     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00266     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00267     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00268     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00269     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00270     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00271 
00272     tcb->entry = entry;
00273     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00274     tcb->self = thread;
00275     tcb->imask = imask;
00276     tcb->name = name;
00277 }
00278 
00279 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00280 
00281 {
00282 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00283     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00284         rthal_enable_fpu();
00285 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00286 }
00287 
00288 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00289 
00290 {
00291 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00292     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00293        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00294     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00295     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00296 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00297 }
00298 
00299 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00300 
00301 {
00302 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00303 
00304     if(tcb->fpup)
00305         {
00306         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00307 
00308         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00309             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00310         }   
00311 
00312 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00313 }
00314 
00315 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00316 
00317 {
00318 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00319 
00320     if(tcb->fpup)
00321         {
00322         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00323 
00324         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00325             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00326         }   
00327 
00328     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00329        could be much lazier. */
00330     if(tcb->user_task)
00331         rthal_disable_fpu();
00332 
00333 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00334 }
00335

00338 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00339 
00340     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00341 }
00342 
00343 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00344 
00345 {
00346     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00347                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00348                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00349                                      NULL,
00350                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00351 }
00352 
00353 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00354 
00355 {
00356     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00357                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00358                                      NULL,
00359                                      NULL,
00360                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00361 }

00364

00367     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00368 }
00369 
00370 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00372 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask)
00373 
00374 {
00375     return 0;
00376 }
00377 
00378 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00379 
00380 {
00381     return 0;
00382 }
00383 
00384 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00385 
00386 {
00387     return 0;
00388 }
00389 
00390 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00391 
00392 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00393 
00394 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00395 
00396 {
00397 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00398     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00399        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00400     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00401 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00402 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00403     xnshadow_release_events();
00404 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00405     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00406     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00407     schedule_timeout(50);
00408     xnarch_release_ipi();
00409 }
00410 
00411 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00412 
00413 {
00414     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00415 
00416     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00417         {
00418         spl_t s;
00419         splsync(s);
00420         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00421         splexit(s);
00422         return 1;
00423         }
00424 
00425     return 0;
00426 }
00427 
00428 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00429 
00430 {
00431 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00432     xnshadow_grab_events();
00433 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00434 }
00435 
00436 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00437 
00438 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00439 
00440 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00441 
00442     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00443     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00444     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00445 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00446     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00447     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00448 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00449     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00450 }
00451 
00452 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00453 
00454 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00455 
00456 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00457                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00458                                            const char *name)
00459 {
00460     struct task_struct *task = current;
00461 
00462     tcb->user_task = task;
00463     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00464     tcb->ksp = 0;
00465     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00466 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00467     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00468     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00469 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00470     tcb->entry = NULL;
00471     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00472     tcb->self = thread;
00473     tcb->imask = 0;
00474     tcb->name = name;
00475 }
00476 
00477 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00478 
00479 {
00480     unsigned irq;
00481 
00482     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00483         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00484                              handler,
00485                              NULL,
00486                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00487 
00488     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00489        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00490        individually. */
00491 
00492     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00493                          handler,
00494                          NULL,
00495                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00496 }
00497 
00498 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00499 
00500 {
00501     unsigned irq;
00502 
00503     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00504         {
00505         switch (irq)
00506             {
00507 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00508             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00509 
00510                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00511                 continue;
00512 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00513 
00514             default:
00515 
00516                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00517             }
00518         }
00519 
00520     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00521 }
00522 
00523 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00524 
00525 {
00526     unsigned irq;
00527 
00528     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00529         {
00530         switch (irq)
00531             {
00532 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00533             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00534 
00535                 continue;
00536 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00537 
00538             default:
00539 
00540                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00541             }
00542         }
00543 
00544     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00545 }
00546 
00547 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00548 
00549 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00550 
00551 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00552     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00553        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00554        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00555        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00556        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00557        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00558     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00559 }
00560 
00561 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00562     rthal_timer_release();
00563 }
00564 
00565 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00566 
00567 {
00568 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00569     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00570 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00571     return 0;
00572 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00573 }
00574 
00575 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00576                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00577                                         unsigned long long defval)
00578 {
00579 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00580     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00581     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00582     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00583 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00584     *shot = defval;
00585     *delivery = defval;
00586 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00587 }
00588 
00589 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00590 
00591 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00592 
00593 #include <linux/init.h>
00594 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00595 
00596 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00597 
00598 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00599 
00600 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00601 
00602 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00603 
00604 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00605 
00606 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00607 
00608 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00609 
00610 {
00611     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00612     fltinfo.exception = evinfo->event;
00613     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00614     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00615 }
00616 
00617 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00618 
00619 {
00620 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00621     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00622 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00623     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00624        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00625     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00626 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00627 }
00628 
00629 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00630 
00631 {
00632     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00633 
00634     if (!nktimerlat)
00635         return -ENODEV;
00636 
00637     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00638 
00639     return 0;
00640 }
00641 
00642 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00643 
00644 {
00645     int err;
00646 
00647 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00648     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00649        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00650     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00651 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00652 
00653     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00654 
00655     if (err)
00656         return err;
00657 
00658     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00659 
00660     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00661         return -ENOSYS;
00662 
00663     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00664                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00665                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00666                               NULL,
00667                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00668 
00669     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00670 
00671 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00672     err = xnshadow_mount();
00673 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00674 
00675     if (err)
00676         {
00677         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00678         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00679         }
00680 
00681     return err;
00682 }
00683 
00684 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00685 
00686 {
00687 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00688     xnshadow_cleanup();
00689 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00690     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00691     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00692 }
00693 
00694 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00695 
00696 #ifdef __cplusplus
00697 }
00698 #endif
00699 
00700 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00701 
00702 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00703 
00704 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
